text:
Assuming inflation, FIFO COGS is lower than LIFO COGS, so subtracting the change
in the LIFO reserve from LIFO COGS makes intuitive sense. When prices are falling,
we still subtract the change in the LIFO reserve to convert from LIFO COGS to FIFO
COGS. In this case, however, the change in the LIFO reserve is negative and subtracting
it will result in higher COGS. This again makes sense. When prices are falling, FIFO
COGS is greater than LIFO COGS.
